repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.unittitle: Neil P. Speirs Collection of U.S Railroad Retirement Board Member Photographs
did.abstract: This collection contains the photographs of Neil P. Speirs, former president of the Switchmen's Union of North America [SUNA], assistant president of the United Transportation Union [UTU], and labor member of the U.S. Railroad Retirement Board.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183 kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Neil P. Speirs was born in Alberta, Canada, on December 25, 1912 and moved to the United States with his parents in 1919. He became a naturalized citizen in 1942. Mr. Speirs graduated from the University of Idaho in 1934, having majored in business and education.

Mr. Speirs began his railroad career with Southern Pacific Railroad, working in the railroad's train yards. He was first elected to the local Grievance Committee of Adjustment for the Switchmen's Union of North America [SUNA], Local 98 (San Francisco, CA) in 1950. In 1952, he was elected as a full-time officer, serving as chairman of the General Grievance Committee of Adjustment, Southern Pacific Railroad [SP]. Mr. Speirs served in this capacity until 1955, when he was elected to serve as SUNA International Vice-President. In 1959, he was elected to be President of SUNA and served as President until January 1, 1969.

On January 1, 1969 SUNA, along with the Order of Railway Conductors and Brakemen, the Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen, and the Brotherhood of Railroad Trainmen formed the United Transportation Union [UTU]. Upon the merger, Mr. Speirs became Assistant President of UTU.

In 1969, President Richard Nixon appointed Mr. Speirs as the Labor Member of the Railroad Retirement Board. In 1974, President Gerald Ford re-appointed him to that position. He retired from the Railroad Retirement Board in 1977, but served on the Arbitration Panel of the National Mediation Board on a part-time basis until 1978.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a photograph scrapbook and loose photographs collected by Neil P. Speirs. The photographs document his various activities as president of SUNA, assistant president of the UTU, labor member of the Railroad Retirement Board, and other activities in which he participated in the course of his work in organized labor. Mr. Speirs' personal scrapbook contains annotation identifying the people in the photographs as well as where and when they were taken. Of note in this album are four photographs of Eleanor Roosevelt at the AFL-CIO convention in Miami Beach, Florida. Many of the pictures in the scrapbook are duplicated in the loose pictures in this collection. Other notable photographs picture Mr. Speirs with President Lyndon B. Johnson in 1965, when the president signed an act authorizing investigation into the use of high-speed ground transportation systems. Many of the photographs are from the various meeting and conventions that preceded the creation of the UTU in 1969. There are numerous picture of Mr. Speirs with the other three union presidents that united to form the UTU. The men are Charles Luna, president of the Brotherhood of Railroad Trainmen, H. E. Gilbert, the president of the Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Engineers, and C. F. Lane, the president of the Order of Railway Conductors and Brakemen. Many of the photographs of these four men may be found in the UTU pamphlets in Collection 6215, ""=Neil P. Speirs Collection of U.S. Railroad Retirement Board Member Files, 1963-1994." Finally, there are many pictures of the participants from the labor group who participated in the U. S. President's Railroad Commission in 1960.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Neil P. Speirs Collection of U.S. Railroad Retirement Board Member Photographs #6215 P. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Personal scrapbook of SUNA events and other labor events

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 39 photographs (photo album, kept together). Pages are laminated, photographs have captions identifying people in photographs. Includes photos of U.S. President's Commission on Railroads, photos of Eleanor Roosevelt at AFL-CIO convention, and photos of various SUNA events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: : Labor chiefs, Presidential Railroad Commission, 1960. Left to right; myself, H.E. Gilbert (President of BLF&E), A.F. Zimmerman, (Assistant Grand Chief, BLE), J.A. Paddock (President of ORC&B), W.P. Kennedy (President of BRT), Secretary of Labor James P. Mitchell. The signing of the agreement to form a presidential Commission to settle work rules and practices disputes in the railroad industry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Carriers, Presidential railroad Commission signing, 1960. Left to right seated; Secretary of Labor James P. Mitchell, G.W. Knight (Director, Labor relations, Pennsylvania railroad), T. Short (Chairman, Committee on Labor Relations, the Association of Western Railways). Standing; Under-Secretary of Labor James T. O'Connell, L.B. Fee, (Vice-president, Seaboard Air Line Railroad), E.H. Hallmann, (Director of Personnel, Illinois Central Railroad Company).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (Left) David McDonald (left), President of the Steelworkers. (Middle) George Meany, President of the AFL-CIO. (Right) Schlitzer, Secretary-Treasurer of the AFL-CIO. (Circa 1960)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (Top) Attending Old Timers' Meeting, Tri-City Local, Rock Island Railroad, 1961. (Bottom) Secretary-Treasurer Collins, myself, and Vice-president Meyers at Meeting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (Top) Safety Award Dinner, sponsored by the BLF&E/ Center right; Mr. and Mrs. Gerard (General Manager, Great Norther), Mr. and Mrs. Robinson (member of the Presidential Railroad Commission), Mr. and Mrs. Fallon (Vice-president of SUNA). March 1962. (Bottom) Reception for Congressman Gonzalas, (Texas) Washington, 1962. From left to right; Phillips (Assistant Prs. BLF&E), myself, Shattuck Vice-president BLF&E), Mr. X. Congressman Gonzalas, Kennedy (Pres. BRT), Gilbert (Pres. BLF&E), Fallon (Vice-president SUNA).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (Top) Myself, Congressman Gonzalas, Kennedy and Gilbert at reception. (Bottom) Newspaper clippings with photo. Left to right: Presidents Neil P. Speirs, Switchmen; Louis J. Wagner, Conductors and Brakemen; H. E. Gilbert, Firemen and Enginemen; Grand Chief Roy E. Davidson, Locomotive Engineers, and President W.P. Kennedy, Trainmen. (circa 1960)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Secretary of Labor Mitchell, myself, Gilbert and brown at Education Seminar. (circa 1960)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (Top) Secretary of Labor addressing Iowa State University students at Seminar. (Bottom) Secretary of Labor Mitchell addressing students. (circa 1960)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (Top) General Chairman Association Meeting, Chicago, 1962. (Bottom) Addressing General Chairmans' Meeting, Chicago, 1962.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (Left) Vice-president Van Heck and Myself at meeting. (Right) International Secretary and Treasurer Collins and members of the Finance Insurance Board (SUNA). Seated left to right; Collins, Schrump, standing, Ratsford, Guy. (circa 1960)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (Left) Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt and George Meany, President of the AFL-CIO, at Convention. (Right) Mrs. Roosevelt and Walter Reuther (right), President of the Auto Workers. (circa 1960)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (Top) Mrs. Roosevelt, Meany, and Shlitzer, Secretary- Treasurer of AFL-CIO. (Bottom) Mrs. Roosevelt addressing AFL-CIO Convention in Miami Beach. (circa 1960)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Page 13: SUNA representatives at Convention, Secretary-Treasurer Collins, Vice-president Meyers, and myself. (circa 1960)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (Top) SUNA representatives at Convention. (Bottom) Other railway labor representatives. (circa 1960)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (Left, Top) Meeting with Local 263 officers, Roseville, California. (Left, Bottom) Seated left to right; Gonzalas (Local Chairman 145), Pantatoni (Legal Council), Standing, O'Connor (Legal Council), myself, Young (Local Chairman 263), Duffy (Local Chairman 262, Sacramento, Western Pacific). (Right) Addressing local meeting, Sacramento, California, 1961.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (Top) Attorney Heiss and Timmerman. (Bottom) SUNA participant for the Presidential Railroad Commission. Left to right; Heiss (attorney), Timmerman (Local Chairman 175, Yuma), myself, Dr. Kaufman (Economist). (circa 1960)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: President and Vice-presidents of SUNA, 1960. From left to right; Clark, Watson, Van Heck, Fallon, Meyers, Stapp.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Labor members of the Presidential Railroad Commission, Washington D.C., 1960. From left to right; Zimmerman (Vice-president of BLE), Sites (Vice-president of BRT), Phillips (Assistant president of BLF&E), Holliday (Vice-president of ORC&B), Fallon (Vice-president of SUNA)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (Top, Right) Sacramento, California, 1955. Seated left to right; Clark (Vice-president), Bruno (President of Local 145), Gonzalas (Local chairman of 145), Shively (Sec.-Tres. Of 145). Standing; McCarthy-(legal counsel SUNA), center; Tunsen, (Top, Left) Nugent addressing dinner. (Bottom, Left) Safety Dinner sponsored by SUNA local 242. (Bottom, Right) Safety meeting, Eugene, Ore., 1958. Standing at right, Nugent (Superintendent of Safety, Southern Pacific).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (Top) Regional Meeting, Sacramento, California, 1958. Left to right; John Burge, mayor of Sacramento, Leo O'Connor (Regional Council of SUNA), Fred Dorius (General chairman, WP), Panatatoni (Regional Council of SUNA). (Bottom) Representative of local lodges in the central California and Nevada areas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Buffalo, New York Headquarters of SUNA (circa 1960)

did.unittitle: UTU Founding, Group photograph of 40-Man Committee

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The committee that served as Delegates to the Unification and Constitutional Convention Held at Hot Springs, Arkansas for the purpose of creating the UTU. May 6, 1968. All delegates in photograph are identified (1 photograph)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Group Photograph of 40-Man Committee who served as Delegates to the Unification and Constitutional Convention held at Hot Springs, Arkansas, Commencing May 6, 1968. Seated in Front Row: C. E. Wible (BRT) Chairman, PRR-E, N.P. Speirs (SUNA) Int'l President, L.E. Chester (BRT) Assistant to President, C.F. Lane (ORCB) President, H.E. Gilbert (BLFE) President, D.W. Collins (SUNA) Int'l Secretary and Treasurer, J.D. Burke (ORCB) General Chairman, NYC, and M.W. Hampton (BLFE) Assistant President. Standing in Middle Row: J. R. Burge (SUNA) General Chairman, SP (PL), C. F. Traynor (ORCB) General Chairman, N&W (W&LE Dist.), W. H. Callies, (ORCB), General Chairman, C&NW, R. D. Hanon (SUNA), General Chairman Camas Prairie, R. M. Crago (BRT) General Chairman, NYC-S, E. Harris (BRT) General Chairman, Transcontinental Bus System, J. F. Hoffman (BRT) Lodge 74 Local Chairman SP (Pac) Rd., J. F. Kalfas, Jr. (ORCB) General Chairman, B&O, W. D. Huff (ORCB) General Chairman, AT&SF(Coast), C. E. Cook (SUNA) Local Chairman 12, Rock Island, M. A. Ross (BLFE) Vice President, M. H. Nelsen (BLFE) Mbr., Joint Relations Committee, R. R. Bryant (BLFE) General Secretary and Treasurer, W.P. Dunn (BLFE) Mbr., Board of Directors, and D. A. Miller (BLFE) Vice President. Standing in Back Row: L. C. Chisholm (SUNA) Chairman, Int'l Board of Directors, R.C. Flanders (SUNA) Local Chairman 374, C of Ga., T. A. Kunz (BRT) General Chairman, UP-SWD, J. L Green (SUNA) General Chairman. Portland Terminal, P. LaRochelle (BRT) General Chairman, Canadian National East, J. M. Hicks (BRT) General Chairman, L&N, C. W. Zies (SUNA) Local Chairman 164, SP(PL), J. R. Snyder (BRT) State Legislative Representative Georgia, T. P. Lovelace (SUNA) Local Chairman 303, SP(PL), W. G. Stanley (ORCB) General Chairman, Ga. Railroad, J. B. Smith (ORCB) General Chairman, N&W, D. S. Pannell (ORCB) General Chairman, L&N, W. W. Carson (ORCB) Senior Vice President, W. D. Hopkins, (ORCB) General Chairman, D&RGW, P.J. Fontana (BLFE) Mbr., Board of Directors, L. J. Broten (BLFE) Chairman, Board of Directors. A. M. Lampley (BLFE) Vice President & National Legislative Representative was absent from the photo due to illness. G. J. Cahill (BRT) General Chairman, New Haven RR, was also absent from photo due to an urgent matter arising on his property.

did.unittitle: Hot Springs, Arkansas. Creation of UTU 1969

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The four union presidents: Luna, Lane, Gilbert, and Speirs (1 photograph) Signing the Agreement to merge four Railroads (sec. Brotherhoods). Presidents of Brotherhood of Brakemen, President of R.R. Firemen, President of Conductors, President of Switchmen. RR. Engineers did not merge with the rest of RR's to form the United Transportation Union.
